duties_responsibilities.duty: Plan, direct, and coordinate construction operations, purchases, financial reporting, and project controls activities for an assigned portfolio of concurrent electrical projects.
Negotiate revisions, changes, and additions to contractual agreements with owners, architects, consultants, clients, suppliers, and subcontractors.
Execute major project purchases in collaboration with the operations team and regional leadership.
Manage project profitability for each project in his/her portfolio of work, including predictive analysis and revenue, cost, and profit forecasting.
Develop and implement quality control programs on projects.
Regularly visit projects to assess performance, progress, and quality and to ensure connectivity with the field and clients.
Prepare budgets for construction activities, oversee progress, and cost reports.
Develop and maintain relationships with peers at clients, architectural and engineering firms, and trade partners to ensure successful outcomes of projects.
Ensure that all safety and environmental policies of the Company and project owners are followed by all project personnel.

education_certification.credential: BS in Construction Management, Electrical Engineering or equivalent work experience
Strong knowledge of materials, methods, and tools required for electrical construction.
Experience managing projects $3 million and above.
Working knowledge of the NEC and be fluent in estimating processes.
Thorough knowledge of all aspects of construction (technology, equipment, materials, means, & methods, etc.)
